website_summaries.verdict: An inexpensive running belt designed for athletes wanting a no-nonsense product at a fair price.
pros: Features 1 large zippered pocket near front of belt for storage convenience
Hole located in front pocket for threading headphones
Customers appreciate the water resistant material
cons: A few owners had issues with the product's durability
A little small when compared with other running belts

website_summaries.verdict: This cleverly designed running belt is a steal with its inexpensive price tag and useful features.
pros: Adjustable waist fits many users for easy sharing
Single larger pocket for smartphones with headphone connector
2 smaller pockets for keys, ID, and other items
cons: Some buyers had problems with the product's durability

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality...falls apart.
customer_reviews.text: I am a daily jogger. Used for about three weeks and this thing is falling apart. First thing I notice is Velcro failing to hold on the small pouch. Almost lost my keys a number of times. Then seam started to come apart on the phone pouch. Also noticed the belt kept getting loose around my waist in spite of constantly adjusting the strap. Turns out the adjustment in the strap just doesn't hold. Last straw...I went to zip up my phone on this evening's jog and the zipper came off in my hand. Again this is after daily use for about 3 weeks. I am returning the item.
customer_reviews.author: Lynda

customer_reviews.title: Zipper broke within a few days.
customer_reviews.text: It came quickly and fit amazingly. I purchased this to use at themeparks because it didn’t look bulky and all I needed to carry around was my tiny wallet and phone. The phone and wallet fit in it great and it was comfortable on rides. I felt like everything was secure and it was great for easy access. After 4 days of continuous use of the zipper, the end of the zipper came undone. (See photo). Frustrated that I won’t be able to use this pack again since I’m an avid themepark enthusiast. Would not recommend for anyone who intends on using this long term.
customer_reviews.author: Tyler

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY.  less then a year.. EASILY RIPPED.. ZIPPER BROKE...SKIN PEELED...
customer_reviews.text: I've used this a lot to workout or just anywhere i go on weekends wearing shorts in sunny california.. First problem was the small pocket pocket ripped. Fine. I did not return. i said no biggie.. Then the zipper handle broke... Again i let it go.. And then the skin of the pocket started to peel. and then zipper itself broke.. zipper never closed the pockets anymore.. I bought this June 28, 2017. LESS THAN YEAR, and it's already unusable... Now I'm looking for another one.. a MORE DURABLE ONE...
customer_reviews.author: Joriz

customer_reviews.title: Great buy
customer_reviews.text: The waist pack I purchased is great! I bought it in black for my highschooler and he loves it. Not only well made, it also is stylish and comfortable to wear. The material is stretchy a bit and lightweight. I will get another one for myself.
customer_reviews.author: Tatiana

customer_reviews.title: This broke the second time I used it. The ...
customer_reviews.text: This broke the second time I used it. The zipper broke. I use a normal small phone, and when I went to zip up my phone, the zipper busted open. Unfortunately, I did not use it right away, and I missed the return option. I would not buy this again, nor suggest anyone else buying it.
customer_reviews.author: Tra

customer_reviews.title: Great quality, great product
customer_reviews.text: Great quality, great belt, outstanding fit for large sized phones, please watch the video uploaded for more details.
customer_reviews.author: Mohammed

customer_reviews.title: Hey you , Runners
customer_reviews.text: Hi. My average 7-9.5 miles per run minimum 3x a week. Hands free and light is how I need my runs to be. How I’m holding my keys and phone are annoyances that I don’t have to deal with anymore. Seriously so annoying, Trying to carry it on my arm or in my sports bra ... no way is this comfortable, ever. ( the arm bands always slip off and out of place on me and overheat my phone) This belt is comfortable and what I wanted. My phone didn’t get sweat on it with this belt. Thank you. Happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Ace

customer_reviews.title: Zipper broke
customer_reviews.text: I can’t seem to find a way to contact the seller about my problem so I’ll write it here. I purchased this belt 2 months ago. I was loving it. It holds a good amount of stuff and doesn’t bounce around. Sometimes the strap loosens a little while running but I think that’s because I also wear a hip belt for running with my dogs so it slides a little more. But the zipper broke. It just spread apart. I can sometimes get it to get on track but mostly it just spreads open again. It’s only 2 months old. I though about buying another one because I did like it. But, the price went up also.
customer_reviews.author: Kim897

customer_reviews.title: Great Value!
customer_reviews.text: This belt is a great value if you're not ready to spend the extra money for a top name running belt. I use it on my daily walks and it works very well. It stays put and doesn't need constant adjusting like some of the other low-cost belts do. The phone pocket was snug at first and I worried I wouldn't be able to fit my Galaxy Note, but after just a couple of uses my phone slid in and out of the pocket with ease. I like that there's an extra compartment for my keys and a little cutout for corded earbuds. Very pleased with the purchase!
customer_reviews.author: SEBTop Contributor: Coloring

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t bounce or shift!
customer_reviews.text: I’m 140lbs and 5’7”. I run often and sometimes long distances. This belt has great stretch and stays in place. My waste is much smaller than my hips and it sits right on my hip and I rarely have to adjust it. The pocket can fit my iPhone 11. It also has a pocket for poop bags when I run with my dog and another pocket for my keys. It doesn’t bounce at all It’s a great running belt.
customer_reviews.author: MKM

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy it
customer_reviews.text: No matter how much you tighten it- it either comes loose or just bounces. Not a fan of this. Would not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Crazy Reader

customer_reviews.title: zipper broke
customer_reviews.text: I was afraid my phone, which is covered by a case, wouldn't fit, but it fits fine. I wear this when running and I don't even know it's there. Update: I've been having problems with the zipper. Today it got stuck and it took me forever to get it open so I could use my phone. I finally got on Amazon to see about returning the item and find it's two weeks past the limit so I am stuck with this. I haven't used this much at all and now it's useless. :-(
customer_reviews.author: L Zaro

customer_reviews.title: Wearing out quickly with daily use
customer_reviews.text: Bought to use while running and hiking. After just a couple weeks of light use the elastic material making up the belt is begining to break down. The ends are separating into the threads and the elastic itself has begun to lose its elasticity. Also, the plastic hardware used to adjust the belts fit by shortening its length does not hold tight enough allowing the belt to gradually widen back out to flop around losely while I am moving. On the plus side it is comfortable to wear and could be great with some design improvements.
customer_reviews.author: Shawn H.

customer_reviews.title: Moves around too much
customer_reviews.text: I was pretty excited to not have to hold my phone anymore when I run. But when I put my phone in the pouch it bounces up and down too much. It’s distracting and uncomfortable. I don’t recommend unfortunately!
customer_reviews.author: Mia Marie

customer_reviews.title: So helpful
customer_reviews.text: This was a fantastic purchase. I do 5Ks, and this works well to hold my phone, ID, and keys. It doesn't fit a whole lot, so you have to minimize. I take my phone out of the case, and I only carry the keys I need, not my whole keychain. The one thing that would be nice would be a separate sleeve for my ID and debit card. I put them with my phone and worry that I'll lose one when I want to look at my phone on a run.
customer_reviews.author: Kirra

customer_reviews.title: Great for walking, running and biking
customer_reviews.text: I bought this originally for when I run. I love having a place to "hide" my phone and keys. I have wide hips (44") and it stays put without riding up. I also use this for when I walk my dog or ride my bike. I have a Samsung Note 10 and it fits with a lil extra room too.
customer_reviews.author: Colie Gutzler

customer_reviews.title: it'll do for now
customer_reviews.text: perfect for my phone and a single key (car key when i go somewhere to run), my only complaint is the belts adjuster on the left side slips around so easy that it as frequently loosening on a run (mostly when touching the belt, or moving it around) and it is not the easiest thing to tighten back up when it comes loose. Had to put a rubber band to minimize its movement. Other than that it is very convenient and much more comfortable than a armband.
customer_reviews.author: Brennan

customer_reviews.title: great and nicely priced
customer_reviews.text: Perfect alternative to a bulky fanny pack. Holds my Iphone 6plus and has an earphone jack, nice pocket with Velcro closure to securely hold my license, atm card and car key. its slim and can be worn under a shirt hidden which is great for crowded outings where I don't want to carry a purse. I am able to carry my big smart phone now hands free when I go for walks, hike, or ride my bike. I like that it lays flush against my body and doesn't jiggle or shift when I am being active.
customer_reviews.author: Cindylu

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely Fabulous!
customer_reviews.text: I’m disabled and use a wheelchair and forearm crutches to get around. So wearing a purse is very difficult for me. Even crossbody bags can be uncomfortable on my sore muscles. I figured this purse would be great for short trips out of the house. But I wear it EVERYWHERE! It holds my iPhone, cash, all my credit, insurance & medical cards. It has a little pocket on the side that’s perfect for my pills and the other side has a little pocket the perfect size for my keys! And the big benefit is it’s so lightweight I don’t even know I’m wearing it!
customer_reviews.author: Mary R.K.

customer_reviews.title: Life Changing for Running Races
customer_reviews.text: Holy crap, why didn't I buy one of these sooner?! This thing fit snugly, didn't bounce around once it settled into place on my hips, and I kind of forgot it was even there. The small velcro pocket held a giant set of rental car keys (two big keys and a fob on a huge metal ring) and the large pocket held both my ancient iPhone (music player) and my Samsung Galaxy S8---snugly, but still easy to zip and open. It was so comfortable I kind of forgot it was there! So much better than carrying stuff in my hands. And the price is right!
customer_reviews.author: WML

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality out of package.
customer_reviews.text: Bad had a tear along the fabric where the zipper when inspecting this item upon delivery. As for storage space, I am still impressed this fits my iPhone XR with it's OtterBox case on though you will need BT headphones as there is absolutely no room for headphones to be attached. Since the quality control prior to shipment is clearly lacking, I wonder what other faults may appear in time.
customer_reviews.author: Johnny R.

customer_reviews.title: So far, I love this belt
customer_reviews.text: I've only used this running belt a couple of times so far but I love it. I used a thinner belt for a long time but it fitted kind of weird specially if I put in more than a couple of items in it. I can comfortably carry my keys, a bag of tissues, some change, a magnetic card and my pepper spray (just in case) in this and it keeps its shape. I complement this with an 8oz water bottle from Fitletic, the belt fits perfectly throught the loop of its carry case, although it moves a little bit while running. Qualitywise it feels durable and well made, the buckle seems sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: Sylvia

customer_reviews.title: Garbage, don't buy
customer_reviews.text: I decided to try it out today for the first time on a bike trip. The moment I opened the zippered pocket for the first time, one of the seams at the side ripped and the zipper slider came off. I didn't even get to use it once. I didn't do anything rough or forceful - just opened the pocket. I am very disappointed and had to improvise today on the bike trip. I am surprised it got all these good reviews.
customer_reviews.author: Jane

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable
customer_reviews.text: I bought exercise waist pack for walking. It’s light weight my lg phone fits just right . I can easily remove without struggle. I can clip my inhaler with no problem. I love the stretch of the waist band comfortable plus I don’t feel like it’s so tight I can’t wait to remove it I’m a size 16 . I used use it on the treadmill and out door walking it’s so light weight with my phone and inhaler that I sometimes forget it’s there.
customer_reviews.author: leila Hashimoto-kalthoum

customer_reviews.title: I'm a Fanny Pack lover now!!
customer_reviews.text: NEVER...EVER did I think I would wear a fanny pack, let alone wear one and like it. I LOVE this fanny pack and see a lot of usage in the future. It was purchased to use at the Orlando theme parks. It was a life saver. Held my s20 phone, car keys, credit card, driver license, cash and kept it all dry. Kept my park and photo pass clipped to the zipper. This fanny pack is comfortable. You don't even really notice it is there. Easy to access items when you needs them. Fanny pack hater turned lover!!
customer_reviews.author: MUSIC

customer_reviews.title: I like it!
customer_reviews.text: It's a relatively good quality for the cost. The adjustable bands are not very big tho. I weigh 145 and 5'3 and it fit me only when I adjusted the bands almost to the end. So it's something to consider if you're bigger than me
customer_reviews.author: Vicky de León

customer_reviews.title: Great product. Great delivery
customer_reviews.text: Exceptionally thin. Not a bulky lump. Perfect size for phone, keys and money. I must add that the delivery people that deliver to my house are FANTISTIC. Always above and beyond and conscientious. They are all a wonderful reflection of the quality of Amazon deliveries
customer_reviews.author: LI Grandma

customer_reviews.title: Just ok
customer_reviews.text: Just ran with this for the first time, and wasn't terribly impressed. It's a decent price, so I'm not mad. It barely fit my Galaxy with a case and getting the headphone end through the opening was difficult. Ultimately that worked out, so not my issue. The problem I had was it loosened immediately as I started running, and I had to keep tightening the strap. Because of this it woudn't stay in place and ended up bouncing around my torso while I fought to keep it down.
customer_reviews.author: Kay

customer_reviews.title: I recommend
customer_reviews.text: I have the Samsung Galaxy Note 9 and it fits without the case on. With my case, which is like an OtterBox but not, it barely fits. I have to squeeze it in. It's handy for running and mowing, which is why I really bought it. I almost had my phone fall out of my pocket once, so this protects it and allows me to listen to my music. The headphone port probably would work if I had my case off, but I use Bluetooth.
customer_reviews.author: Channon

customer_reviews.title: Fits well and stays in place.
customer_reviews.text: I took the time to read several reviews on this as well as comparing it with other belts. I really like this one. It serves my purpose purpose perfectly. It holds my iPhone 8 with plenty of room to spare. Along with the zipper pocket for my phone there is a small pocket with a velcro tab for keys or coins. I put my Kleenex in there along with lip balm. I am a 5 mile a day power walker. I run some of these miles but the majority of it is fast-paced walking. The belt stays in place just fine.
customer_reviews.author: Debbie

customer_reviews.title: Great Buy
customer_reviews.text: It was exactly what I needed. I initally brought it for travel reasons. It was small enough to fit under my shirt. So that is where I held my I'd and extra money since I didnt want to carry a case. My personal phone (Notes 10+) doesnt fit) but my work phone (iPhone 8) does fit. When I wore it to work out in, it is water resistant. It was comfortable to move around it. Would definitely buy it again
customer_reviews.author: S. McDaniels

customer_reviews.title: BOUNCES while jogging due to elastic waist band
customer_reviews.text: It's pocket size is great, and if you're just standing or walking it's very comfortable. However, the straps are elastic and if you have anything like your phone or something as heavy inside, it bounces while jogging no matter how tight and no matter if you wear it on your hips or waist. I just tried it out for a minute in the house and it was an automatic "not going to work". Going to have to return it. Not willing to jog for miles with it jostling around.
customer_reviews.author: Fawn H. Hensley

customer_reviews.title: Decent Item for the Cheap Price
customer_reviews.text: Pros: -Low profile and comfortable for walking -Holds large iPhone XR -Seems sturdily made Cons: -Does ride up sometimes when running especially if wearing over a slick fabric -Adjustable belt loosens itself while running but a small clip would prevent this -Not huge pockets, especially the side Velcro one that barely contains my single car key fob but that goes with the low profile design I suppose Overall: Decent item for the price. Does need readjusting sometimes but I like it a lot better than the armbands. Would recommend for the casual runner.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: perfect
customer_reviews.text: this little fanny pack is perfect. I was looking for something to hold things while I walked my dog. There is an adjustable comfortable waist band that easily buckles then one large pocket and two small pockets. Not very large and Cant fit many items but perfect for my needs. I can fit my iphone 11 pro max in the large pocket and my key fob in the smaller one.
customer_reviews.author: Olivia Cotroneo

customer_reviews.title: Overall good
customer_reviews.text: It’s a really nice, well made running belt. However, the waistband is elastic, so 1) it stretches out as I run & 2) it makes the pouch bounce around. Not ideal for a runner. It works best when I turn it so the pouch is on my back... somehow bounces less that way. I think it would be perfect if the band wasn’t elastic. Definite flaw, but I’ll still use it & make the best of it. The pouch itself is sturdy & holds all I need - my phone, keys, chapstick & fecemask.
customer_reviews.author: Mianca10

customer_reviews.title: Does not fit iPhone 11 with Otterbox Defender case
customer_reviews.text: The product material seems great, though there was a part of the seam just starting to come apart. I might have kept it despite that, because the belt overall is fits nicely for running. However, I have an iPhone 11 with the Otterbox case. Just a heads up to anyone with that phone/case combo. I could get it in the waist pack if I squeezed it, but it was too tight of a fit in my opinion. I wouldn't be able to access it easily. If you had a different case or smaller phone, it would work fine.
customer_reviews.author: MandM

customer_reviews.title: Great for runners
customer_reviews.text: My wife and I wore these when we ran a half marathon. I had enough room in mine to hold my phone, several Gu Energy Gel packs, my wallet, and some Burt's Bees lip balm. The pack was comfortable for the entire run, since the pocket is long and flat so the weight from all that stuff was distributed across my waist and there weren't any spots that stuck out obtrusively. Highly recommended for runners, or anyone who likes a fanny pack but wants one thin enough to conceal under a long shirt because let's be honest, fanny packs are not fashionable but they are useful and this one could be easily hidden.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Almost perfect for the job
customer_reviews.text: I use this to hold my phone while I ride horses. It works exactly as it should. It is very slim, no extra bulk. It is small though. It will hold only my phone, maybe some folded cash or a credit card, but definitely not a phone and wallet or large mess of keys like I have. Only reason I didnt 5 star it is because it doesnt stay the size I like. I adjust it very small to be snug around my waist, but as I work it loosens. It has never slid off or had a problem because of it, but I would prefer it if I could keep it snug.
customer_reviews.author: DebbieD

customer_reviews.title: Tight fit
customer_reviews.text: This workout fanny pack is amazing.. It's firm on me when I run and do various excercises.. The only draw back which I gave it 4 stars for is because from the reviews I read that it can fit a note 10 an few other various things...not ture. My note 10 fits in really really snug.. Wish it was a smidge bigger on the sides.. But other then that it's great
customer_reviews.author: Adina Negru

customer_reviews.title: Bounced around with running
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a last minute replacement for my previous running belt that broke right before my half marathon. I found that it bounced around the whole time, no matter how much I fidgeted with the strap. I do like the small velcro pocket to the side for easy access to chap stick etc. Would probably be fine for walking or biking but wasn't great for me for running.
customer_reviews.author: sweetasiam

customer_reviews.title: Seriously, it's not a "fanny pack"
customer_reviews.text: My favorite thing about this running belt is that it's nice and slim so it doesn't feel or look like I'm wearing a fanny pack. My husband still makes fun of me and says that's what it is. There's a little velcro pocket where I keep a housekey but found the key fob for my car fits in it as well. The zipper pocket is a great size for an average smartphone (my Moto Z Force Droid with slim silicon case fits well) but it's a bit of a squeeze to get anything else in with it. Sometimes I put a small, slim wallet in with my phone and it is a tight fit but it'll still zip
customer_reviews.author: Nicole

customer_reviews.title: Useless in less than a year.
customer_reviews.text: Used this product 3-4 times a week to hold my keys and my phone while running. The belt not remaining tight when adjusted was the first problem I encountered....no biggie, but then the velcro on the small pouch stopped velcro-ing...becoming annoyed. 7 months after purchase, zip'd my phone in before a run, and the zipper zip'd right off, leaving my phone trapped inside.....now I am pissed. I clumsily fiddled with it trying to get the zipper back on, and the zipper began to unravel. As my head exploded from complete frustration I came to terms that this pack is completely useless now, and I am now shopping for a new one.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: My daughter ordered black but we received The light blue bag. The blue is nice but she chose black so that it didn’t stand out so much. It’s Christmas time right now and the crime has been sky high. The criminals have been ripping people’s bags right off of their arms. This bag was so that she could carry minimal things and be able to hide it under clothing. It’s pretty comfortable to wear. It fits an IPhone 11 pro.
customer_reviews.author: James Rodrigues

customer_reviews.title: Great for running my half marathon
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my half marathon to hold my phone. I have a iPhone 7 Plus (with a card holder on the back). It is definitely a tight fit, but it does hit in the largest pocket. The waist strap is adjustable, but when you get it to towards the largest setting, it doesn't stay that well in place. But it didn't bounce or anything while I was running, sometimes I had to reach down to make sure it was still there! Would recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Lisa Magee

customer_reviews.title: NOT WATER RESISTANT
customer_reviews.text: THIS IS NOT WATER RESISTANT. The first test I did on this belt was to put a piece of paper inside where my phone would go. I dipped it shut, and I ran water over the belt. Water seeped in at the top where it zips and got the paper wet. I'm not sure if they should instead state this as SWEAT resistant, but I expected water resistant to mean that if it started pouring down rain on me, my phone would be fine. I cannot use this for the original purpose I intended to buy this belt for, unfortunately.
customer_reviews.author: Jenna

customer_reviews.title: Good running pouch
customer_reviews.text: I use this pouch to run. I can fit my smartphone with its case on my ID and an ipod nano (yes I still have and use that) in the pouch easily. There is still room in there too but it's not a bulky pouch. I have my keys in the mini pouch on the side - this velcro closed which is nice; it makes my keys feel secure. And there is another small pouch in the other side. The band is thick enough that it doesnt stretch too easily and sink down my hips- a problem I've had with a different running pouch. Useful. Good stuff.
customer_reviews.author: Erin

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight but Doesn't Stay Adjust and Rides Up
customer_reviews.text: Love how light and durable it is. Fits comfortably under my running tops. The problem is it doesn't stay adjusted and rides up when running. I literally have to pull it supper low and it will eventually still make its way back up until its rubbing against my upper stomach. It might be because I am pretty petite. 5'2" and 96lbs 32"hips for reference.
customer_reviews.author: BK3773

customer_reviews.title: Good Hidden Fanny Pack
customer_reviews.text: Needed something for extra storage while going for a run. I'm a woman, so pants made for women are unfortunately very limited when it comes to pockets and if they do have pockets, no zipper pockets so running means you're risking losing everything in your pockets. And I am a little too embarrassed to carry around a fanny pack. This is a great alternative to a fanny pack because I can actually hide it under a baggy tee shirt and love that these have zippers.
customer_reviews.author: Mel

customer_reviews.title: Will do for now
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for something I could wear around my waist while out walking and exercising. I have an iPhone X Max and it is the only thing that will fit into the long zipper portion of the pouch. I have a small card wallet which I could also probably fit behind the phone but I definitely cannot fit my car key fob and house keys in as well. I may have to work on paring down my key chain.
customer_reviews.author: BookLover

customer_reviews.title: Zipper is no good
customer_reviews.text: Zipper failed upon first use. Contacted the company - I received an email from them asking how I liked it and to leave a review - they told me to contact amazon instead of letting them know. Essentially they were just emailing me and wanting a reply if I was 100% satisfied. It's really too bad because I liked everything else about it, but it isn't usable without a working zipper.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for walks, the gym and store errands!
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for walks and going to the gym. I also use it for running quick errands to the store without having to take a purse. It fits my phone (even with it's heavy duty bumper cover/protector on it) as well as my little wallet where I have a few credit cards and my driver's license. It also has a couple of tiny pockets that fit my lip balm. 😊 I don't care if anyone thinks I'm a dork for having a fanny-pak! It works great for me!! The only down side is it doesn't keep the measurement well. I have to tighten it up and it always loosens up again. It's not constant, but it happens enough to mention it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Super Shopper

customer_reviews.title: Awesome work out "fanny pack"
customer_reviews.text: So, yes, I bought a fanny pack. I never thought I would be that person but I'm so glad I did. I bought it for speed walking and it is amazing! I'm a curvy woman and it fits and stays on my hips. It has adjustable straps to loosen and tighten as needed. It's fits under my shirt and you can barely tell that I have one on. I have a note 8 phone which is huge and it fits in the front pocket and has a hole for my ear dilley's to go through. It also has another pocket to hold my car keys. I love this and I'm so glad I purchased it.
customer_reviews.author: LiLi Berg

customer_reviews.title: Roomy but doesn't cinch up tight
customer_reviews.text: I finally replaced my 3-year-old waist pack with the Dimok product, and it gets the job done overall. I'm able to adjust the waist band, but it does not stay in place. The elastic material is a bit slick so it tends to slide back to the area of least resistance which is at my waist. I prefer to wear this on my hips, but the band loosens to the point that it moves up to my waist and rubs against my skin. The price is right if you don't mind where the product sits.
customer_reviews.author: Beachbum 74

customer_reviews.title: Too small for my phone
customer_reviews.text: I ordered black, but received neon yellow, and my Samsung Galaxy S7 in its OtterBox case does not even fit inside. I wouldn't have minded the color swap, if only the dang phone had fit. For the record, if I wanted to remove the phone from the OtterBox, it would fit, but it would max out the space.
customer_reviews.author: LLB

customer_reviews.title: It Was Pretty Decent
customer_reviews.text: When I first received it and opened it out of the package, I worried it wouldn't fit around my waist but it stretched but it was not a binding stretch. I did have a hard time getting it out of the pocket to change music but it was great to keep in the pouch that wasn't too bulky looking like the fanny packs.
customer_reviews.author: Ami

customer_reviews.title: Great item
customer_reviews.text: As advertised fits my galaxy note 9 with a non bulky case (not sure if it would fit with a large case or battery extender). Has a nice wide elastic band to go around the body so my things will not bounce around.
customer_reviews.author: Nicole

customer_reviews.title: Not the one in the photos
customer_reviews.text: The one I received was different. It did not have the brand name on it as shown in the product photos and photos from other reveiwers. It also shows 2 smaller pockets, one with a flap, on either side of the wide zipper pocket. Mine only had one small pocket and on the other side of the larger pocket, an open space with an elastic strap. What could I put there? A bottle of water? That is not how this item was advertised. I will be returning it and look for another one.
customer_reviews.author: Joan Piwowar

customer_reviews.title: Phone and keys!
customer_reviews.text: I really like this belt; I hate fanny packs and although I'm not a runner, I have a dog that gets a lot of walking. I like putting my phone in the belt as well as house keys and it keeps them 'hidden'; I don't like just walking around with my phone in my hand and don't always have pockets available. This keeps it hidden under my shirt and keeps my hands free to hold the leash and focus on the walk with my dog.
customer_reviews.author: ChefWitch

customer_reviews.title: better than I expected
customer_reviews.text: I like the slim profile; I am a nurse in a wound clinic. It is the perfect size to hold scissors, pens, camera etc. and small enough to not get in the way
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent low profile phone holder.
customer_reviews.text: Love this little item. Flexible, very low profile. Stretchy for a great fit, with an easy buckle for instant on and off. Looks more like a wide belt than a fanny pack. I usually wore it under a flowy shirt and it was unnoticeable. I did not like the reflective stripe, so I just carefully removed the stitches and took it off.
customer_reviews.author: rosenh

customer_reviews.title: Won't stay cinched
customer_reviews.text: The size of this running back is fine. My issue with it is that the cinches will not stay put. I have 35 inch hips, and each time I use it, I have to tighten the plastic "buckles." Often when I am exercising/hiking, these buckles slip back to original position which causes the waist pack to truly slip up to my waist. Can't recommend.
customer_reviews.author: G

customer_reviews.title: Great Fit - Issue with Headphone Port
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this for a couple of weeks and it works great. It's easy to forget that I'm wearing it on runs because it fits so well and is light. I usually have my smartphone, dog poo bags, and keys inside and they fit with no problem. Only complain it that the plastic port where the headphones go in/out is coming apart from the belt. I might try to stitch it back together or maybe ask for a new belt if it rips totally off. Right now it's still functional but just looks bad.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This sleek belt pack is the best.
customer_reviews.text: This belt pack is the best! I use it when I power walk and carry my iphone, tissues, house keys and chap stick in it no matter what the weather. It is sleek, light weight and comfortable; easy to forget it’s even there! I also appreciate the easy adjustment of the belt without any dangling straps. I highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Marie Botsford

customer_reviews.title: Love this product
customer_reviews.text: This belt is perfect for exercise walking. It has a cord hole for your headphones and is roomy enough to accommodate a wallet, a phone and your keys. It is not bulky and very comfortable to wear. It has elastic built into the waistband so it will not slide down or loosen up like some other belts of this nature. For my needs it is perfect...I am VERY pleased
customer_reviews.author: Michael Kaiser

customer_reviews.title: Nice quality and size
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to carry my older iPhone and my inhaler. I use it mainly when exercising at gym or walking outside. I need my hands free because I use forearm crutches to walk . It’s a nice size and seems to stay put while moving. Also I have been out in inclement weather and my phone stayed dry and safe. So far good purchase and good fabric quality .Belt very adjustable I’m a size 12/14 lots of room to spare.
customer_reviews.author: susan johnson

customer_reviews.title: Best decision for my s20 ultra!
customer_reviews.text: After sailing to find good armbands that would hold my s20 ultra during runs i looked for other ideas this was the first thing I tried. Im loving it it just fits my s20 ultra and my galaxy vud case and keys it dosemt bounce it sits close to bod and isn't really noticeable or bulgy i made the right choice.
customer_reviews.author: Skeletor

customer_reviews.title: Like it, but wish the strap of the belt were different.
customer_reviews.text: I love using this belt on my walks because it fits my phone and key, which is what I needed it for. I also like the little hole for my headphones. My only complaint is about the strap. It's stretchy, which might be good for some, but being a curvy female, it naturally wants to contract and keeps sliding up my hips. I would rather have a plain, adjustable nylon belt that stays put. Other than that, though, I really like it.
customer_reviews.author: J.D.

customer_reviews.title: I like it!
customer_reviews.text: Comfortable and easy to wear and get into once it is on your body. Would have given it 5 stars had there been a second zip pocket. Originally bought for gym then changed gyms and don't need for that, however am going to Hawaii soon and think it will come in handy for activities that I don't want to lug around a purse. Has enough room for essentials - ID, key, money, phone, lip gloss and water bottle.
customer_reviews.author: MADow

customer_reviews.title: Great for running holds my id
customer_reviews.text: Great for running holds my id, credit card and iPod. Excellent slim fit.. looks great and feels great.. only problem i have is i cant get the the buckle to stay tight.. it tends to lose up on its own while running. it doesn't fall off but it does it lose after tightening it to the max. maybe it's user error on my side but it loosens on its own while running
customer_reviews.author: RockstarG

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable
customer_reviews.text: No dislikes. This one has a little smaller pouch the the phone. I bought this for my wife and she loves it. She has the galaxy 8 edge and it fits just fine. It is very comfortable to wear and doesn't bounce around since it is adjustable. I would recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Jim bec

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable, practical, great customer service
customer_reviews.text: I love this pack. I workout with it 5 days per week lifting weights & have run with it. It’s not bulky. It holds m iPhone & Keys. It’s actualky attractive on and looks more like a belt. An odd thing happened with the zipper after a couple of weeks, I went to zip it and it came off in my hands. I wrote customer service & literally just a few hours later, they responded & took care of things. 5 Star by me for any company that backs their product with such attentiveness and deligence.
customer_reviews.author: Love the Lord

customer_reviews.title: A running must have!
customer_reviews.text: This is a must have for runners - especially if you use wireless headphones. Super comfortable. The smaller pocket is great for holding keys to not scratch the screen of your phone or for holding your AirPod case. Will be purchasing again when I need a new one!
customer_reviews.author: E. Tejada

customer_reviews.title: Compact, does not bounce around and stretches to accommodate items within reason
customer_reviews.text: I have just started using it. Comfortable, stretchy, hugs you, does not bounce about and well made. It is compact ie takes my iPhone 8 with its case but can’t put my rather large wallet besides it. Still room for additional cards and money. The key pouch is great, it looks small but will expand to accommodate car keys with the fob plus a couple of keys with it. I guess it’s always a balancing act to come to a size that makes the most sense. I like it.
customer_reviews.author: Babadadhi

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable but not practical.
customer_reviews.text: The material is super soft, when walking with this belt I could see how it might work. However, no matter how much I tightened it before my run, the belt would loosen immediately once I started to run. It became so much more of a nuisance than just carrying my phone when I run. I was a bit disappointed by this. So: Good for walking. Useless for running.
customer_reviews.author: Danielle Kennedy

customer_reviews.title: This product was GREAT! I finished my half marathon
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product because I had an upcoming race and the arm band I was wearing was heavy and uncomfortable with my large phone inserted. I wanted something that was light weight, water resistant and barely noticeable while attached to my body. This product was GREAT! I finished my half marathon, and did not have any discomfort from wearing this waist pack - I didn't notice it at all while I was running. I also didn't expect to test out the water resistance, but it rained! Sure enough my phone and other supplies stayed dry. I would definitely recommend this product to any other runner, hiker, or even a traveler! 5 stars!
customer_reviews.author: Remy

customer_reviews.title: Nice, light and flat
customer_reviews.text: Great little pack for excercising. My iphone XR fits perfectly in the main pocket with a little room to spare (1/2" around) and the key pocket is nice. I hadn't noticed when I ordered the other side also has elastic across maybe for a water bottle, but not sure if it would slide out if you were running since there's no bottom piece of elastic to hold it. Great value though.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy J. Lindenmayer

customer_reviews.title: useless crappy zipper - don't waste your money.
customer_reviews.text: update: received an email saying it was just a defective batch and that they were sending me a replacement. Never received anything. the quality of the zipper is pathetic. the zipper will come open at the slightest tug. will not even attempt to use it since the crappy zipper will not stay closed. Cannot risk having my phone flying out while running. looking to return it, if not too much hassle. don't waste your money on this.
customer_reviews.author: alann

customer_reviews.title: Stays in place while running! 🏃‍♂️
customer_reviews.text: this pack is the best! Its stays put when i run or walk. The pocket perfectly fits my samsung galaxy s10 plus and key for my house. The side pocket is perfect for my inhaler since I have asthma. Nicely made and adjustable. Seriously doesn't budge while running!!
customer_reviews.author: melody

customer_reviews.title: Won’t stay tight during a run. Try something else.
customer_reviews.text: It holds my phone, keys, and AirPods. It is reasonably comfortable and I have not noticed a problem with sweat getting through. The problem is that the straps won’t stay tight enough to stay up. No matter how tight I make it, the straps loosen and have to be adjusted every couple of minutes. It was a good price, but useless for a run.
customer_reviews.author: Adam/Allison Scott

customer_reviews.title: Useful!
customer_reviews.text: I've used this during all of my runs and I love having it because it really feels so lightweight even with my phone inside. The only issue is I have to hike it up around my tummy sometimes or even higher because it slips a lot even when you've tightened it.
customer_reviews.author: Irene S.

customer_reviews.title: Awesome belt to walk in
customer_reviews.text: I just received the belt and went out walking. It is super comfortable; you don’t even know it’s there. It’s stretchy. I’m at size 16 and it doesn’t dig in. It holds my iPhone X, money, and a few keys.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa Renee

customer_reviews.title: Functional but doesn't stay in place
customer_reviews.text: Fits a phone, keys, and headphones. Did get a little sweaty during my workouts but more annoyingly, it doesn't stay in place because the elastic causes it to creep up your hips toward the waist as it contacts. I hoped this would stay low around my hips but it kept sliding up and flopping around. Takes some getting used to but functional overall.
customer_reviews.author: TS

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable and efficient
customer_reviews.text: I had a different running belt prior to this one, which I was very satisfied with. A neighbor highly recommended this one and I have been extremely happy with it. The other belt had a slightly bigger second compartment, which easily housed my keys and credit cards which I preferred, but this one is working out well. Haven't had the opportunity to use it in rainy weather.
customer_reviews.author: Lee Lichter

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: I can't say anything about the water resistance really.. I've not tested that out... but I Love this very comfortable nicely made out of the way pouch to hold my phone..my step counter....I have bought two of these. just to color coordinate...one red one black. bought the red one some time ago and loved it so much bought another one.
customer_reviews.author: 123elroy

customer_reviews.title: Carries the essentials for running
customer_reviews.text: Great running belt. I use this exclusively for running. The belt takes some adjustment to get it in place (I like to wear it low around my hip bones) but once I get it situated it generally stays put. It fits snug to avoid bouncing and the fabric is relatively soft. I wore it during a marathon and wound up with some significant chafe, but have never had any issues any other runs. Large pocket carries my phone, small Velcro pocket holds keys, and small open pocket holds pepper spray.
customer_reviews.author: Al

customer_reviews.title: Perfection
customer_reviews.text: This thing totally changed my workouts. I can fit my LG G6, in its case, in it with room to spare, and my gym locker key in the little pouch inside it. It's comfortable and very adjustable. It totally solved my problems of A) women's workout clothing not having pockets for keys and phones, and B) smacking my headphone cords constantly while running. I would say to those complaining about it riding up, just adjust it and wear it around your waist instead of your hips. Problem solved.
customer_reviews.author: Savanna

customer_reviews.title: Good Quality
customer_reviews.text: No defects or cheap material, well made. my cellphone and smart key fit perfect, free of dangling. I have a Galaxy note 9 with thin case. If you have Note 9 size phone with thick, monster look cover case, the pocket may be too tight to close.
customer_reviews.author: Steven

customer_reviews.title: My next Hal marathon accessory
customer_reviews.text: Perfect! PERFECT for running - does not move and inch nor feels like a heavy/weird weight bouncing around your waist. Ran a 10k with it and fit two cards, my cellphone, a small microfiber towel on one side and a couple of CLIF blocks in the pocket and I didn’t have to adjust or even think about the belt during the whole race. TRY IT! you’ll leave your arm band at home forever.
customer_reviews.author: MARA E.

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase!!
customer_reviews.text: I switched to this waistband because I was so tired of my arm band. This product is wonderful and well worth the money. It hold all of my belongings during races so I don’t have to worry about where to put my car keys. After putting on the belt, I do not have to adjust the belt at all. It stays perfectly in place! Even when I’m covered in sweat and have gotten my phone out multiple times. I highly suggest this product!
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: Don't go on runs/walks with this!
customer_reviews.text: This is the perfect tool for running and walking! Or any outdoor activity! It's not bulky at all. The biggest pocket is only big enough to hold a cell phone, so it's not really slouchy. There are also smaller pockets that can fit keys or a small knife.
customer_reviews.author: Meghan

customer_reviews.title: Amusement park belt
customer_reviews.text: I’m not a runner but I bought this to be able to go hands free at amusement parks without wearing a visible “fanny pack”. It’s very comfortable and fits my phone, license and credit card. It isn’t invisible under a fitted t shirt and shorts but you have to look closely to see it. I’ve comfortably and securely worn it twice to amusement parks and it served its purpose well. I recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: LaLa

customer_reviews.title: It works, but may not be the best option if you need to adjust to a smaller size.
customer_reviews.text: The belt is elastic and it doesn't stay in place well when adjusted to the smallest setting. I regularly have to reposition the straps to keep it tight during my runs. The pocket is nice and it holds my Note9 and pepper spray well. I just with the elastic was a little more resilient or the adjuster had a grip or friction to resist the slow slide the comes from the running cadence.
customer_reviews.author: Haylie Culp

customer_reviews.title: Does not stay Adjusted
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this pack for running, walking and for wearing my phone while I paint. It is adjustable, but does not stay adjusted. It easily slides back to the largest setting and makes my phone bounce. I would not buy this one again. I also purchased the AIKENDO pack and it stays in place much better.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Works !
customer_reviews.text: When I purchased this I was worried it wouldn’t fit my iPhone 8plus , it does with a little more room . It’s comfortable, doesn’t bounce when you run and it even has a little pocket in the front that held my garage door remote perfectly!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very flimsy zipper - beware!
customer_reviews.text: Zipper broke off without warning. I run every day and at the end of my run today, I went to unzip the pouch to get my iPhone out and the zipper came off in my hand. Very disappointing. I’ve been very good to this. The only way to get my iPhone out was to force the zipper open. Poorly made zipper. I do not recommend this for every day use.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Struczewski

customer_reviews.title: Pretty Good
customer_reviews.text: This is perfect for my workouts; it's slim and even when full doesn't fewl heavy or look bulky. Only thing I would change is I wish there were more pockets to separate your cresit cards/ID - with everything having to go on the main pocket, if you need to pull one thing out, everything else has to come out (or it falls out by itself, regardless).
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good, but not perfect
customer_reviews.text: I can't use the pinhole for the headset because I have to use a connector to my iPhone 7. It ends up bending the wires, so I'm afraid it will shorten the life of the headset. Also, I wish both key pockets closed. And I have to remove the belt when I get in the car because the buckle hurts my back. So good, but not perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Atlanta Ladies

customer_reviews.title: It depends.
customer_reviews.text: It’s ok, but given the cost, gotta give it 5 stars. Smaller than I imagined, but description was accurate. Got it to secure phone/wallet when going on roller coasters on vacation. Items barely fit, too much of a hassle. Might use in other vacations to hide $$$$.
customer_reviews.author: D. Perryman

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic for Running!
customer_reviews.text: What can I say, a tiny belt with many pockets. I ran a half marathon back in April and was able to store my iPhone 6, cash, credit cards, keys and even energy gels with more room to spare! The belt stayed in place the entire race and did not weigh me down or feel like a fanny pack. Very cute and sweat resistant too. I highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Trendychic04

customer_reviews.title: Very poor quality
customer_reviews.text: Bought this as a gift and was unable to return because of the timing. ZIPPER IS HORRIBLE. Unzipped amd never recipes again. Thought this would be perfect for a friend to take overseas to hold money, Keys, credit cards under his clothing. Would have been a great belt if it zipped back up.
customer_reviews.author: sangel0399

product_meta.title: dimok Running Belt Waist Pack - Water Resistant Runners Belt Fanny Pack for Hiking Fitness – Adjustable Running Pouch for All Kinds of Phones iPhone Android Windows
product_meta.description:
This great product fits so perfectly that you won't even know it's there. The elastic straps and adjustable belt keep everything comfortably snug and close, preventing the annoyance of bouncing items. The neoprene material prevents sliding, so when you take out your smartphone, you don't accidentally pull out all your credit cards at the same time. 

Ideal for all kinds of sports and exercise, including obstacle course running. You'll always have your phone ready to take that epic photo when the chance arises. 

You can also use the belt as a treat bag for dog walks or as a wallet/purse during everyday activities. The "Runner's Favorite" dimok running belt is the best Christmas gift and perfect for running any time even at night with a large reflective stripe - you can run but you can't hide.
feature_bullets: CONVENIENT- Keep your most needed items close while exercising or running errands. With your busy life style, it is so important to be able to quickly reach all must-have stuff
ADJUSTABLE - Fits waist sizes from 28" to 49" with flexible and adjustable belt, you can wear dimok bag on top of clothes as you layer for the winter runs.
WATER RESISTANT - Neoprene material ensures all your items stay dry, through rain, mud, sleet and snow. It is machine washable and made for heavy duty use.
SLIMLINE DESIGN - Dimok waist pouch prevents items from bouncing around while you run, jog, walk or traverse obstacles
SATISFACTION GUARANTEED - Get our best running belt under 10 dollars for yourself or workout gift and you'll love it

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
